abstract: Target has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them from Amazon.
snippet: Target has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them from Amazon.
lead_paragraph: Target, signaling its growing irritation with its rival Amazon, announced on Wednesday that it would stop selling the online retailer’s Kindle e-readers.

headline.main: Target, Unhappy With Being an Amazon Showroom, Will Stop Selling Kindles
headline.print_headline: Target, Unhappy With Being an Amazon Showroom, Will Stop Selling Kindles

byline.original: By Stephanie Clifford and Julie Bosman

abstract: Also, Target stops selling Kindles for Amazon, and BSkyB distances itself from News Corporation.
snippet: Also, Target stops selling Kindles for Amazon, and BSkyB distances itself from News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: A quiet April has left CNN with its lowest-rated month in 10 years, Brian Stelter writes. When big news breaks, people still tune in to CNN — and it made a record profit for its parent, Time Warner, of $600 million. But Jeffrey Bewkes, the Time Warner chief executive, is unhappy at the declining ratings and expects his lieutenants to make changes, employees said in interviews.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Pressure on CNN, and Raunchy Jokes on Iraqi TV
